      • Graph

        public Graph()
        Initializes all variables.

      • Graph

        public Graph(Graph g)
        Creates a given graph from the passed graph g. All values of g are passed to the given graph. Note: edge/vertex references are kept no new vertices or edges are created
        Parameters:
        g - The given graph to be duplicated.

      • Graph

        public Graph(java.io.File input)
        Creates a graph from a file input. File contains the following information: Number of vertices; A number of edges E; E lines containing edges with the starting vertex, a tab, the ending vertex, a tab and the weight of the edge.
        Parameters:
        input -

      • anEdge

        public static boolean anEdge(java.lang.Object o)
        Determines whether the passed object is an Edge.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to check to see if it is an Edge
        Returns:
        False if null, if not an instance of an Edge, if vertices are not vertices; True otherwise.
        See Also:
        isWorkingGraph(Graph, boolean), aVertex(Object)

      • aVertex

        public static boolean aVertex(java.lang.Object o)
        Determines whether the passed object is a Vertex.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to check to see if it is a Vertex
        Returns:
        False if null, name less than 0, and if in and out are null; True otherwise.
        See Also:
        anEdge(Object)

      • isWorkingGraph

        public static boolean isWorkingGraph(Graph g,
                     boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Determines whether graph is a workable graph, or a graph that can be processed. That means that it is not null and has some vertices that can be worked on.
        Parameters:
        g - The graph to check to see if working.
        unDirectedGraph - Indicated whether the graph is undirected at the discretion of the user.
        Returns:
        False if g is null, g has no vertices, g has none legitimate edge; True otherwise. If graph undirected and an edge has no conjugate, it returns false.
        See Also:
        aVertex(Object), anEdge(Object)

      • printGraph

        public void printGraph(boolean printEdgesVertices)
        Prints the graph object I.D. Followed by, if printEdgesVertices is true, a list of the edges and vertices of the given graph.
        Parameters:
        printEdgesVertices - If true prints the vertices and edges of the graph.

      • insertEdge

        public void insertEdge(Vertex a,
              Vertex b,
              int w)
        Creates a weighed edge and inserts it into the adjacency list.
        Parameters:
        a - The starting vertex or origin
        b - The ending vertex or destination
        w - The weight of the edge
        See Also:

        w - The ending vertex or destination
        See Also:

      • resetGraphLabels

        public void resetGraphLabels()
        Resets the edge/vertex labels on the Hashtable. Note: It puts in the label UNEXPLORED for everything.

      • getAVertex

        public Vertex getAVertex()
        Returns a randomly picked vertex from the adjacency list.
        Returns:
        A randomly picked Vertex or null if the graph is empty.

      • containsVertex

        public boolean containsVertex(Vertex v)
        Sees if the passed vertex is present in the graph.
        Returns:
        True if the adjacency list contains the passed vertex; false otherwise.

      • containsEdge

        public boolean containsEdge(Edge e)
        Sees if the passed edge is present in the graph.
        Returns:
        True if the adjacency list contains the passed edge; false otherwise.

      • edgeContainsLabel

        public boolean edgeContainsLabel(Label l)
        Determines whether there is any edge that has the Label l in the graph's Hashtable
        Parameters:
        l - The label to be checked
        Returns:
        True if any edge has the label l; false otherwise
        See Also:
        containsLoop(), vertexContainsLabel(Label), isDirectedWeaklyConnected(), isConnected(), isDirectedStronglyConnected()

        See Also:

      • containsLoop

        public boolean containsLoop()
        Determines whether there are any edges that create a loop, i.e. any BACK or CROSS edges.
        Returns:
        True if there is any edge that has the label BACK or CROSS; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        LoopFinderDFS(Vertex, boolean), hasLoop(boolean), vertexContainsLabel(Label), edgeContainsLabel(Label)

        See Also:
        removeVertex(Vertex)

      • hasLoop

        public boolean hasLoop(boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Determines whether the given graph has any loops. Note it resets graph labels.
        Parameters:
        unDirectedGraph - True if graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True if LoopFinderDFS finds any back edges; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        LoopFinderDFS(Vertex, boolean), containsLoop()

      • LoopFinderDFS

        public boolean LoopFinderDFS(Vertex v,
                    boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Determines whether the connected component v is in has any loops.
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex to start a DFS loop finder at.
        unDirectedGraph - True if graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True if it ever finds a BACK edge; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        Object.hashCode()

      • DFS

        public void DFS(boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Runs a Depth First Search (DFS) on the given graph. Only Labels are changed.
        Parameters:
        unDirectedGraph - True if graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        LoopFinderDFS(Vertex, boolean), hasLoop(boolean), ccDFS(Vertex, boolean)

      • ccDFS

        public void ccDFS(Vertex v,
         boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Runs a Depth First Search (DFS) on the connected component v is in. Only labels are changed.
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex to start the DFS at.
        unDirectedGraph - True if graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        DFS(boolean), hasLoop(boolean), LoopFinderDFS(Vertex, boolean)

      • spanningForest

        public Graph spanningForest(boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Runs a DFS on the given graph and creates a new graph that contains only the vertices and the DISCOVERY edges.
        Parameters:
        unDirectedGraph - True if graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        A graph which is a spanning forest. Only DISCOVERY edges exist in the graph.
        See Also:
        DFS(boolean), ccDFS(Vertex, boolean)

      • ccReverseDFS

        public void ccReverseDFS(Vertex v,
                boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Runs a reverse DFS, i.e. incoming edges are exploited instead of outgoing edges.
        Parameters:
        v - Vertex to run reverse DFS on.
        unDirectedGraph - True if graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isDirectedStronglyConnected()

      • BFSShortestPath

        public int BFSShortestPath(Vertex s,
                  Vertex v,
                  boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Finds the shortest unweighed path from s to v if there is one.
        Parameters:
        s - The starting vertex.
        v - The vertex whose distance from the starting the vertex has to be determined.
        unDirectedGraph - True if graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        Cases: if s is v : 0; if s is isolated from v: -1; otherwise : distance from s to v.
        See Also:
        BFS(boolean), ccBFS(Vertex, boolean)

      • BFS

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Vertex>>> BFS(boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Runs a Breadth First Search (BFS) on the given graph.
        Parameters:
        unDirectedGraph - True if graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        Triple nested ArrayList of vertices for (general to specific) the connected components, the breadths of the search, the level of breadth during the search and the vertex.
        See Also:
        BFS(boolean), BFSShortestPath(Vertex, Vertex, boolean)

      • containsNegativeWeightEdges

        public boolean containsNegativeWeightEdges()
        Searches the graph for any edges with negative weights if there are any.
        Returns:
        True if any edge has a negative weight; false otherwise.
        See Also:
        weightsAllEqual()

      • weightsAllEqual

        public boolean weightsAllEqual()
        Determines whether all the edges have the same weight. Uses the Transitivity principle to determine this in linear runtime.
        Returns:
        False if any edge doesn't have the same weight as its neighbor; otherwise true.
        See Also:
        containsNegativeWeightEdges()

      • ccBFS

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<Vertex>> ccBFS(Vertex v,
                                                     boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Runs a BFS on the connected component containing v.
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex to start the BFS at.
        unDirectedGraph - True if graph is undirected; otherwise false.
        Returns:
        Double nested ArrayList of vertices for (general to specific) the levels of breadth, each breadth level and the vertices.
        See Also:
        BFS(boolean), BFSShortestPath(Vertex, Vertex, boolean)

      • isTree

        public boolean isTree(boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Determines whether the given graph is a tree.
        Parameters:
        unDirectedGraph - True if the graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        True if the given graph is connected and doesn't have any loops.
        See Also:
        hasLoop(boolean), isConnected()

      • isDirected

        public boolean isDirected()
                   throws InvalidGraph
        Determines whether the graph is directed or one way.
        Returns:
        True if there is an edge that has no conjugate; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidGraph - If the graph does not have any edges, it can't be undirected or directed.

      • isSpanningSubgraph

        public boolean isSpanningSubgraph(Graph g)
        Determines whether the passed graph is a spanning subgraph of the given graph, i.e. they have the same set of vertices.
        Parameters:
        g -
        Returns:
        False if the number of vertices in g is not equal to those in the given graph or if they don't share the same set of vertices; true otherwise.
        See Also:
        isConnected()

      • isDAG

        public boolean isDAG()
              throws InvalidGraph
        Determines whether the given graph is a directed acyclic graph (DAG).
        Returns:
        True if the given graph is directed and has no loops; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidGraph - If graph doesn't have any edges, it can't be directed or undirected.
        See Also:
        isConnected(), hasLoop(boolean)

      • aTopologicalSort

        public java.util.Hashtable<Vertex,java.lang.Integer> aTopologicalSort()
                                                               throws InvalidGraph
        Finds a topological order of the given graph in O(V) time.
        Returns:
        A Hashtable with a topological value (value) for each Vertex (key).
        Throws:
        InvalidGraph - If the graph is not a DAG it can't have a topological order.
        See Also:
        vertexWithNoOutgoingEdges()

      • vertexWithNoOutgoingEdges

        public Vertex vertexWithNoOutgoingEdges()
        Finds a vertex in the graph with no outgoing edges.
        Returns:
        If there is one a Vertex with no outgoing edges.
        See Also:
        aTopologicalSort()

      • isDirectedWeaklyConnected

        public boolean isDirectedWeaklyConnected()
                                  throws InvalidGraph
        Determines whether the given graph is weakly connected.
        Returns:
        True if the graph is weakly connected; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidGraph - If the graph is not directed it can't be weakly connected.

      • isDirectedStronglyConnected

        public boolean isDirectedStronglyConnected()
                                    throws InvalidGraph
        Determines whether the directed graph is strongly connected or that it can reach all other vertices from the given vertex.
        Returns:
        True if there is only one vertex or it is strongly connected; false otherwise.
        Throws:
        InvalidGraph - If the graph has no edges or vertices, or it's not directed it can't be strongly connected.
        See Also:
        isDirected(), isDirectedWeaklyConnected(), ccDFS(Vertex, boolean), ccReverseDFS(Vertex, boolean), resetGraphLabels()

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Determines whether the given graph is connected or weakly connected if the given graph is directed.
        Returns:
        False if there are no edges or vertices; True if there is one vertex or the graph is connected.
        See Also:
        explorer(Vertex), resetGraphLabels()

      • FWTransitiveClosure

        public Graph FWTransitiveClosure(boolean allowSelfLoop)
        Produces a transitive closure of the given graph.
        Parameters:
        allowSelfLoop - True if the method is allowed to produce self loops; otherwise false.
        Returns:
        A transitive closure of the given graph or null if there is less than 2 vertices or there are no edges.
        See Also:
        resetGraphLabels()

      • explorer

        public void explorer(Vertex v)
        Performs a DFS on all edges, incoming or outgoing, and labels all vertices and edges.
        Parameters:
        v - The vertex to explore next in the DFS
        See Also:
        isDirectedWeaklyConnected()

      • DijkstraShortestPaths

        public java.util.Hashtable<Vertex,java.lang.Integer> DijkstraShortestPaths(Vertex s)
                                                                    throws DijkstraNegativeWeightEdge
        Runs Dijsktra's shortestpath on the given graph and determines the shortest path from s to all other vertices.
        Parameters:
        s - The shortestpath length is found from s to all other vertices.
        Returns:
        A Hashtable containing the length of shortest paths (value) from s to each other vertex (key).
        Throws:
        DijkstraNegativeWeightEdge - Dijkstra's Algorithm can't process negative weight edges because it violates the Triangle Inequality which is the basis for the Algorithm.
        See Also:
        BFSShortestPath(Vertex, Vertex, boolean), BellmanFordShortestPaths(Vertex), aBellmanFordShortestPathTree(Vertex), aDijkstraShortestPathTree(Vertex), containsNegativeWeightEdges(), weightsAllEqual()

      • aDijkstraShortestPathTree

        public Graph aDijkstraShortestPathTree(Vertex s)
                                throws DijkstraNegativeWeightEdge
        Runs Dijkstra's shortestpath on the given graph and produces a shortestpath tree.
        Parameters:
        s - The vertex used to produce its shortestpath tree to all other vertices.
        Returns:
        A shortestpaths tree from s.
        Throws:
        DijkstraNegativeWeightEdge - Dijkstra's Algorithm can't process negative weight edges because it violates the Triangle Inequality which is the basis for the Algorithm.
        See Also:
        containsNegativeWeightEdges(), weightsAllEqual(), DijkstraShortestPaths(Vertex), BellmanFordShortestPaths(Vertex), aBellmanFordShortestPathTree(Vertex)

      • BellmanFordShortestPaths

        public java.util.Hashtable<Vertex,java.lang.Integer> BellmanFordShortestPaths(Vertex s)
        Runs BellmanFords shortestpath on the given graph and determines the shortest path from s to all other vertices.
        Parameters:
        s - The shortestpath length is found from s to all other vertices.
        Returns:
        A Hashtable containing the length of shortest paths (value) from s to each other vertex (key).
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - There is no shortestpath for a graph with no vertices.
        See Also:
        aBellmanFordShortestPathTree(Vertex), aDijkstraShortestPathTree(Vertex), DijkstraShortestPaths(Vertex)

      • aBellmanFordShortestPathTree

        public Graph aBellmanFordShortestPathTree(Vertex s)
        Runs BellmanFords shortestpath on the given graph and produces a shortestpath tree.
        Parameters:
        s - The vertex used to produce its shortestpath tree to all other vertices.
        Returns:
        A shortestpaths tree from s.
        See Also:
        BellmanFordShortestPaths(Vertex), aDijkstraShortestPathTree(Vertex), DijkstraShortestPaths(Vertex)

      • aPJMinimumSpanningTree

        public Graph aPJMinimumSpanningTree(boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Produces a Prim Jarnick Minimum Spanning Tree.
        Parameters:
        unDirectedGraph - True if the graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        A minimum spanning tree.
        See Also:
        aKruskalMinimumSpanningTree(boolean)

      • aKruskalMinimumSpanningTree

        public Graph aKruskalMinimumSpanningTree(boolean unDirectedGraph)
        Produces a Kruskal Minimum Spanning Tree.
        Parameters:
        unDirectedGraph - True if the graph is undirected; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        A minimum spanning tree.
        See Also:
        aPJMinimumSpanningTree(boolean)
